integerES.cpp

00001 
00061 //
00062 // Evolution strategy for solving nonlinear integer problems according to
00063 //     Rudolph, G. (1994). An evolutionary algorithm for integer
00064 //     programming. In PPSN III, LNCS 866 Springer.
00065 //
00066 #include "EALib/sqr.h"
00067 #include "ZNconfig.h"
00068 #include "EALib/Population.h"
00069 
00070 //=======================================================================
00071 //
00072 // fitness function: x' x -> min according to
00073 //     Schwefel, H.P. (1977). Numerische Optimierung von
00074 //     Computer-Modellen mittels der Evolutionsstrategie.
00075 //     Birkhaeuser.
00076 //
00077 double problem_1_1( const std::vector< int >& x )
00078 {
00079     unsigned i;
00080     double   sum = 0;
00081 
00082     for( i = 0; i < x.size( ); ++i )
00083         sum += sqr( x[ i ] );
00084 
00085     return sum;
00086 }
00087 
00088 //=======================================================================
00089 //
00090 // main program
00091 //
00092 int main( int argc, char **argv )
00093 {
00094     //
00095     // constants
00096     //
00097     const unsigned Mu           = 30;
00098     const unsigned Lambda       = 100;
00099     const unsigned Dimension    = 30;
00100     const unsigned Iterations   = 150;
00101     const unsigned Interval     = 5;
00102     const unsigned NStepSizes   = 1;
00103 
00104     const int      MinInit      = -1000;
00105     const int      MaxInit      = +1000;
00106     const double   StepSizeInit = 1000/3.;
00107 
00108     const bool     PlusStrategy = false;
00109 
00110     unsigned       i, t;
00111 
00112     //
00113     // initialize random number generator
00114     //
00115     Rng::seed( argc > 1 ? atoi( argv[ 1 ] ) : 1234 );
00116 
00117     //
00118     // define populations
00119     //
00120     Population parents   ( Mu,     ChromosomeT< int    >( Dimension  ),
00121                                    ChromosomeT< double >( NStepSizes ) );
00122     Population offsprings( Lambda, ChromosomeT< int    >( Dimension  ),
00123                                    ChromosomeT< double >( NStepSizes ) );
00124 
00125     //
00126     // minimization task
00127     //
00128     parents   .setMinimize( );
00129     offsprings.setMinimize( );
00130 
00131     //
00132     // initialize parent population
00133     //
00134     for( i = 0; i < parents.size( ); ++i ) {
00135         dynamic_cast< ChromosomeT< int >& >
00136             ( parents[ i ][ 0 ] ).initialize( MinInit, MaxInit );
00137         dynamic_cast< ChromosomeT< double >& >
00138             ( parents[ i ][ 1 ] ).initialize( StepSizeInit, StepSizeInit );
00139     }
00140 
00141     //
00142     // selection parameters (number of elitists)
00143     //
00144     unsigned numElitists = PlusStrategy ? Mu : 0;
00145 
00146     //
00147     // standard deviations for mutation of the step size
00148     //
00149     double   tau = 1. / sqrt( double( Dimension ) );
00150 
00151     //
00152     // evaluate parents (only needed for elitist strategy)
00153     //
00154     if( PlusStrategy )
00155         for( i = 0; i < parents.size( ); ++i )
00156             parents[ i ].setFitness( problem_1_1( dynamic_cast< std::vector< int >& >( parents[ i ][ 0 ] ) ) );
00157 
00158     //
00159     // iterate
00160     //
00161     for( t = 0; t < Iterations; ++t ) {
00162         //
00163         // generate new offsprings
00164         //
00165         for( i = 0; i < offsprings.size( ); ++i ) {
00166             //
00167             // select two random parents
00168             //
00169             Individual& mom = parents.random( );
00170             Individual& dad = parents.random( );
00171 
00172             //
00173             // define temporary references for convenience
00174             //
00175             ChromosomeT< int >& objvar =
00176                 dynamic_cast< ChromosomeT< int >& >( offsprings[ i ][ 0 ] );
00177             ChromosomeT< double >& stepSize =
00178                 dynamic_cast< ChromosomeT< double >& >( offsprings[ i ][ 1 ] );
00179 
00180             //
00181             // recombine object variables discrete, step sizes intermediate
00182             //
00183             objvar  .recombineDiscrete    ( mom[ 0 ], dad[ 0 ] );
00184             stepSize.recombineIntermediate( mom[ 1 ], dad[ 1 ] );
00185 
00186             //
00187             // mutate object variables by adding the difference of two
00188             // independent geometrically distributed random numbers
00189             // to each component,
00190             // mutate step sizes lognormally distributed
00191             //
00192             stepSize.mutateLogNormal( tau,  0 );
00193             // step Size less than 1 is not sensible
00194             stepSize.cutOff( 1, MaxInit );
00195             objvar  .mutateDiffGeom ( stepSize, true );
00196         }
00197 
00198         //
00199         // evaluate objective function (parameters in chromosome #0)
00200         //
00201         for( i = 0; i < offsprings.size( ); ++i )
00202             offsprings[ i ].setFitness( problem_1_1( dynamic_cast< std::vector< int >& >( offsprings[ i ][ 0 ] ) ) );
00203 
00204         //
00205         // select (mu,lambda) or (mu+lambda)
00206         //
00207         parents.selectMuLambda( offsprings, numElitists );
00208 
00209         //
00210         // print out best value found so far
00211         //
00212         if( t % Interval == 0 )
00213             std::cout << t << "\tbest value = "
00214                  << parents.best( ).fitnessValue( ) << std::endl;
00215     }
00216 
00217     return 0;
00218 }
